snippet: The attack in Kandahar in the south was the first so-called insider attack in more than a month.
abstract: Afghan soldier opens fire on coalition forces in southern Afghanistan, killing one soldier and wounding at least four others in first so-called insider attack in more than month; shooting follows steep decline in such assaults in Afghanistan compared with year earlier.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Matthew Rosenberg, Sharifullah Sahak and Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The attack in Kandahar in the south was the first so-called insider attack in more than a month.

headline.main: In Insider Attack, an Afghan Soldier Opens Fire on Coalition Forces, Killing One
headline.print_headline: In Insider Attack, an Afghan Soldier Opens Fire on Coalition Forces, Killing One

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
